metadata.feature_description: Delete wiki articles with proper cleanup of related data

steps.action: Navigated to wiki article 'Draft Test Article - Jan 16 2026'
steps.expected: Article page loads with Delete button visible
steps.actual: Article page loaded successfully with Delete link in the article toolbar

steps.expected: Confirmation dialog appears asking 'Are you sure to delete this article?'
steps.actual: Confirmation dialog appeared with 'Delete this article?' title, 'Are you sure to delete this article?' message, and Yes/No buttons

steps.expected: Dialog closes and article remains intact
steps.actual: Dialog closed and article remained on the page unchanged

steps.action: On article 'Draft Test Article - Jan 16 2026' which has 1 comment, clicked Delete link

steps.expected: Article is deleted along with its comment, redirected to Community page
steps.actual: Article was deleted successfully, redirected to Community page

steps.action: Navigated to deleted article URL directly
steps.expected: 404 error page indicating article no longer exists
steps.actual: 404 Error Page displayed with message 'Sorry, the page you are looking for cannot be found and might have been removed'

steps.action: Navigated to published article 'Published Test Article - Jan 16 2026'
steps.expected: Published article page loads with Delete button visible
steps.actual: Published article page loaded with full content (Introduction, Main Section, Subsection One, Subsection Two, Nested Details, Conclusion) and Delete link visible

steps.action: Clicked Delete link and confirmed with 'Yes'
steps.expected: Published article is deleted, redirected to Wiki list page
steps.actual: Article was deleted successfully, redirected to Wiki list page showing 29 articles (reduced from before)

observations: Code review confirms deletion is permanent - there is no 'Restore deleted article' functionality in the codebase. The ArticleController.Delete() method permanently removes: notifications, revisions, journal entries, comments, subscriptions, and the article itself.

Delete from notification functionality exists in code (NotificationServiceController.DeleteArticle) but requires receiving a pending approval notification first, which was not testable in this session.
Permissions are handled through ModuleSecurity - as SuperUser, all delete operations were permitted. Testing with restricted users would require a different test setup.
